intro: Trybliocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to tropical regions of Africa, Madagascar, and the Indian Ocean islands. They are characterized by their showy, often fragrant white or cream-colored flowers and are typically epiphytic, growing on trees or rocks. The leaves are usually broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Trybliocalyx species are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and unique floral structures.
